ii developer incentive program  4021  4040 article i economic and community development incentive program purpose a the city of lewiston is committed to the promotion of quality development in all parts of the city and to improving the quality of life for its citizens in order to help meet these goals the city of lewiston will consider providing incentives for the retention andor expansion of existing businesses located within the city of lewiston and to encourage the establishment of new businesses within the city of lewiston such incentives will be provided in accordance with the procedures and criteria outlined in this article however nothing in this article shall imply or suggest that the city of lewiston is under any obligation to provide any incentive to any applicant  and all such decisions and actions shall be at the sole discretion of the lewiston city council all applicants for economic development incentives will be considered on an individual basis b it is the intent of the city of lewiston to offer economic development incentives on an individual basis so that the total package of incentives if any may be designed specifically for each business that is proposed this approach will allow the city of lewiston the flexibility necessary to satisfy the unique needs and concerns of each applicant and the needs and concerns of the city of lewiston and its citizens  12317   62617 eligibility requirements an applicant andor the applicants proposed business must meet the following minimum requirements in order to be considered for the economic and community development incentive program 1 the applicant must identify and commit to a project that will benefit the public such project may include but is not limited to a new or improved public utility infrastructure such as water sewer gas or electricity  b new or improved roads sidewalks curbs gutters parking lots parks or open spaces  c rehabilitation of a historical building built prior to 1940  d removal of blighted areas or slum clearance  e protection and conservation of public health  and f elimination of crime 2 within twelve 12 months of issuance of a certificate of occupancy the proposed business must create at least fifteen 15 new fulltime equivalent positions within the city of lewiston for the purposes of this article a fulltime employee means an employee who is expected in the normal course of employment to provide at least two thousand eighty 2080 compensated hours during a consecutive 12month period for purpose of this article a fulltime equivalent position means any combination of seasonal or parttime employees whose compensated hours during a consecutive 12month period equal two thousand eighty 2080 hours 3 within twelve 12 months of issuance of a certificate of occupancy the average wage paid to fulltime employees of the proposed business shall be at least twice the idaho minimum wage or fifty 50 percent of the median family income published by housing and urban development for nez perce county whichever is greater the calculation methodology shall use the us census bureau american community survey median family income estimates with an inflation factor based on the congressional budget office forecast of the national consumer price index 4 the applicant shall provide medical dental and vacation benefits to fulltime employees of the proposed business 5 if the applicant proposes to establish a new business in a building to be constructed by the applicant in the city of lewiston then the applicant shall provide new capital investment equal to or in excess of one million five hundred thousand dollars $150000000 if the applicant proposes to expand an existing business in the city of lewiston or establish a business in a building located in the city of lewiston that has been vacant for at least one 1 year then the applicant shall provide new capital investment equal to or in excess of five hundred thousand dollars $50000000 for purposes of this article new capital investment means property improvements that will enhance the assessed valuation of the land and buildings on the property  12317   5 62617   32618 available incentives a the city of lewiston offers the following incentive options for qualifying applicants 1 expedited permitting process the city of lewiston may expedite the permitting process required for a business location or expansion as allowed by law 2 waiver of fees the city of lewiston may waive all or a portion of the following fees associated with the establishment or expansion of a business a business license fees b land use application and plan review fees and c building permit fees however if the city of lewiston uses the services of an outside consultant to review an application construction documents or for any other purpose necessary to facilitate the issuance of a permit then such consultant fees shall not be waived b the incentives offered to each applicant will depend upon the needs of and the benefits created by the proposed business c any waiver of fees shall not exceed the amount of estimated city taxes to be levied on the capital improvements of the proposed business within seven 7 calendar years after receipt of the certificate of occupancy d any waiver of fees shall not exceed five 5 percent of the estimated assessed valuation of the land and buildings of the proposed business at the time of issuance of the certificate of occupancy  12317 application procedure a a written application for the economic and community development incentive program shall be submitted to the community development department b an application for the economic and community development incentive program shall be initiated before an applicant applies for permits for construction of the proposed business c an application for the economic and community development incentive program shall contain at a minimum the following information 1 the applicants name name of business entity principal place of business physical mailing address telephone number fax number email address website address and contact information of an officer or employee of the applicant who is responsible for completing the application  2 a legal description of the property where the proposed business will be located along with a subdivision plat or record of survey showing the precise location of the proposed business  3 a description of the proposed improvements or expansion including but not limited to a the proposed businesss estimated total cost of construction  b the type of business operation proposed the number and types of jobs that will be created and the anticipated wage or salary of each job position  c a description of benefits that will be available to employees  d the expected source of labor to fill such jobs  e the projected date of the commencement of construction of the proposed business  f the projected date of commencement of business operations  and g the expected duration of the proposed business at the subject location based on history of company operations  4 a description of the type of incentives requested  5 a description of how the proposed new business business expansion or property improvements will be financed  6 a business plan for the proposed business  and 7 such other information as required or requested by the city of lewiston  12317   32618 evaluation a city of lewiston staff shall evaluate an application for the economic and community development incentive program taking into consideration the following factors 1 revenue benefit to the city of lewiston  2 number and quality of jobs created  3 strength of public benefit to the city of lewiston including benefits to existing businesses in the city of lewiston by virtue of the proposed business being within the supply chain or building on an existing economic cluster such as ammunitions paper products boat builders viticulture valueadded agriculture or information technology  4 ability of the proposed business to spur additional economic development in the city of lewiston  5 impact of the proposed business on existing businesses within the city of lewiston  and 6 the applicants willingness to construct public facilities and infrastructure including but not limited to parks pathways public parking public open space and public recreation facilities either on or off site b after evaluating an application and within thirty 30 days of receipt of a complete application city of lewiston staff shall provide a written recommendation to the lewiston city council c the lewiston city council may adopt or reject in whole or in part the recommendation of city of lewiston staff or otherwise approve or deny an application for the economic and community development incentive program based upon its review of the application and the criteria set forth in this section  12317   32618 incentive agreement a if the lewiston city council approves an application for the economic and community development incentive program then the applicant shall enter into an incentive agreement with the city of lewiston enumerating the type of incentives granted and the conditions applicable to such incentives b all incentive agreements shall be in writing and at a minimum include 1 a description of the incentives to be provided and the extent thereof  2 the commencement date of the incentives and the duration of the incentives  3 a legal description of the property where the business will be located  4 detailed information annual financial reports state andor federal employment reports and nez perce county tax appraisal statements  7 a method for the city of lewiston to recover all waived fees and costs that are lost as of lewiston authority to record a lien on the property  8 a provision requiring the applicant to keep accurate financial records sufficient to demonstrate applicants performance of the terms and conditions of the incentive agreement  9 a provision allowing the city of lewiston to inspect the applicants financial records upon reasonable advance notice during normal business hours and requiring the applicant to provide copies of such records at the applicants expense upon written request by the city of lewiston  10 a provision requiring the applicant to repay all incentives in the event the application contains any misstatement or misrepresentation of material fact together with interest at a rate of ten 10 percent per annum from the date each fee would have otherwise become due together with a penalty in the amount of five 5 percent of the total amount of the fees waived  11 a provision requiring the applicant to pay the citys reasonable attorney fees and costs in the event legal action is required to enforce the incentive agreement  12 a provision stating that the incentive agreement is nontransferable and requiring the applicant to promptly disclose to the city of lewiston than seventyfive 75 percent of the assets of the business  and 13 such other provisions as the lewiston city council deems appropriate c an incentive agreement may be amended only upon a writing duly executed by the lewiston city council and the applicant in no case however shall the nature or purpose of the proposed business be changed from what was generally described in the original scope of work or budget  12317   32618 discontinuance of incentives changing economic conditions and availability of funds may cause the lewiston city council to modify amend or discontinue the economic and any incentive agreement to which it committed before the discontinuance of the economic and community development incentive program  12317 secs 408  4020 reserved article ii developer incentive program purpose a the city of lewiston recognizes the benefits of and is committed to the promotion of quality development and redevelopment in all parts of the city and to improving the quality of life for its citizens in order to help meet these goals the city of lewiston will consider providing incentives for the development and redevelopment of blighted areas undeveloped areas underdeveloped areas and areas that are developed but not to current city standards such incentives will be provided in accordance with the procedures and criteria outlined in this article however nothing in this article shall imply or suggest that the city of lewiston is under any obligation to provide any incentive to any applicant  and all such decisions and actions shall be at the sole discretion of the lewiston city council all applications for developer incentives will be considered on a casebycase basis b it is the intent of the city of lewiston to offer developer incentives on a casebycase basis so that the total package of incentives if any may be designed specifically for each development that is proposed this approach will allow the city of lewiston the flexibility necessary to satisfy the unique needs and concerns of each applicant and the needs and concerns of the city of lewiston and its citizens  62617 definitions a blighted area means any area in which there is a predominance of spaces  high density of population and overcrowding  the existence of conditions that endanger life or property by fire or other causes  or any combination of such factors is conducive to ill health crime site contamination declining property values or otherwise detrimental to public health safety morals or welfare blighted area includes a brownfield site b brownfield site means a tract of land that has been developed for commercial or industrial purposes and is polluted c developer means an individual or business entity that 1 purchases land andor a buildings 2 develops such land andor buildings by constructing a new buildings or renovating an existing buildings and 3 leases or sells such land and buildings once development of such is complete d undeveloped land means a tract of land that has not previously been developed other than for agricultural purposes andor with one 1 homestead  62617 eligibility requirements an applicant must meet the following minimum requirements in lots parks or open spaces  c removal of blighted areas or slum clearance  d protection and conservation of public health  and e elimination of crime 3 if an applicant proposes to develop undeveloped land within the city of lewiston then the applicant shall provide infrastructure investment and building construction equal to or in excess of five million dollars $500000000 such development may be done in a phased approach over a period of one 1 to three 3 years 4 if an applicant proposes to develop a blighted area within the city of lewiston then the applicant shall provide infrastructure investment and building construction equal to or in excess of three million dollars $300000000  62617 available incentives a the city of lewiston offers the following incentive options for qualifying application for the developer incentive program taking into consideration the following factors 1 revenue benefit to the city of lewiston  2 strength of public benefit to the city of lewiston regardless of whether the proposed development is commercial or residential  provided however development that benefits residents in lowtomoderate income ranges andor provides singlefamily homes condominiums or apartments will be considered a priority  3 remediation of brownfield site  4 conformance with the city of lewiston comprehensive plan  5 ability of the proposed development to spur additional economic development in the city of lewiston  6 impact of the proposed development on existing businesses within the city of lewiston  and 7 the applicants willingness to construct public facilities and infrastructure including but not limited to parks pathways bus stops public parking public open space and public recreational facilities either on or offsite beyond the minimum required by city code b after evaluating an application and within thirty 30 days of receipt of a complete application city of lewiston staff shall provide a written recommendation to the lewiston city council c the lewiston city council may adopt or reject in whole or in part the recommendation of city of lewiston staff or otherwise approve or deny an application for the developer incentive program based upon its review of the application and the criteria set forth in this section  62617   32618 incentive agreement a if the lewiston city council approves an application for the developer incentive program then the applicant shall enter into an incentive agreement with the city of lewiston enumerating the type of incentives granted and the conditions applicable to such incentives b all incentive agreements shall be in writing and at a minimum include 1 a description of the incentives to be provided and the extent thereof  2 the commencement date of the incentives and the duration of the incentives  3 a legal description of the property where the development will occur  4 detailed information regarding the type number location and cost of planned improvements  5 a provision requiring the applicant to certify in writing that the applicant is in compliance with the incentive agreement  6 a provision requiring the applicant to provide documentation substantiating the level of value provided by the applicants development to the city of lewiston including estimated construction costs and land value appraisal  7 a method for the city of lewiston to recover all waived fees and costs that are lost as a result of the incentive agreement if the applicant fails to perform its obligations under the incentive agreement which method may include a provision in the incentive agreement that gives the city of lewiston authority to record a lien on the property  8 a provision requiring the applicant to keep accurate financial records sufficient to demonstrate applicants performance of the terms and conditions of the incentive agreement  9 a provision requiring the applicant to repay all incentives in the event the application contains any misstatement or misrepresentation of material fact together with interest at a rate of ten 10 percent per annum from the date each fee would have otherwise become due together with a penalty in the amount of five 5 percent of the total amount of the fees waived  10 a provision requiring the applicant to pay the citys reasonable attorney fees and costs in the event legal action is required to enforce the incentive agreement  11 a provision stating that the incentive agreement is nontransferable and requiring the applicant to promptly disclose to the city of lewiston in writing any transfer of ownership of the applicants business any sale or transfer of shares in the applicants business that results in a change of control of the business or any bulk sale of more than seventyfive 75 percent of the assets of the business  and 12 such other provisions as the lewiston city council deems appropriate c an incentive agreement may be amended only upon a writing duly executed by the lewiston city council and the applicant in no case however shall the nature or purpose of the proposed development be changed from what was generally described in the original scope of work or budget  62617   32618 discontinuance of incentives changing economic conditions and availability of funds may cause the lewiston city council to modify amend or discontinue the developer incentive program at any time in the event that the lewiston city council discontinues the developer incentive program the city of lewiston shall honor any incentive agreement to which it committed before the discontinuance of the developer incentive program  62617 secs 4029  4040 reserved smokefree air short title this chapter shall be known as the city of lewiston smokefree air  31317 authority this chapter is adopted pursuant to the authority granted by idaho  and 50304  31317 findings and intent a the city of lewiston finds that smoking tobacco products is inherently dangerous and individuals who are subjected to secondhand smoke have increased health risks such as lung cancer heart disease asthma respiratory infections middle ear infections and sudden infant death syndrome b the city of lewiston finds that smoking electronic cigarettes that contain nicotine andor other chemicals is dangerous nicotine is an addictive substance and exposure to nicotine during pregnancy may harm the developing fetus resulting in low birth weight preterm delivery and stillbirth nicotine also has negative impacts on adolescent brain development and has been associated with cognitive and behavioral impairments further cancercausing chemicals have been found in electronic cigarettes  and liquid used in electronic cigarettes presents a risk of poison c the city of lewiston wishes to provide breathable clean smokefree air in public buildings and outdoor spaces to protect the health of residents visitors employees and nonsmokers  31317 definitions a ecigarette means any electronic oral device such as one composed of a heating or ultrasonic element battery andor electronic circuit which provides a vapor of nicotine andor another substance and the use or inhalation of which simulates smoking this term shall include any such device whether manufactured distributed marketed or sold as an ecigarette ecigar epipe or under any other product name or descriptor b outdoor space means an outdoor area owned managed or maintained by the city of lewiston for a public purpose excluding public rightsofway c public building means a building or facility owned managed or maintained by the city of lewiston where the public is invited or permitted for any purpose d smoking means inhaling exhaling or burning of tobacco or the carrying or possession of any lighted heated or smoldering tobacco whether contained in a cigar cigarette pipe or any other object this term does not include possession of an unlit or unheated cigar cigarette or pipe this term also includes using an ecigarette to inhale or exhale vapors containing nicotine andor other substances  31317 prohibition of smoking in public buildings and outdoor spaces smoking shall be prohibited in all public buildings and outdoor spaces smoking shall also be prohibited within twenty 20 feet of all entrances and exits of public buildings  31317 posting of signs and removal of ashtrays in all public buildings and outdoor spaces where smoking is prohibited by this chapter the city of lewiston shall 1 clearly and conspicuously post a no smoking signs or the international no smoking symbol consisting of a pictorial representation of a burning cigarette enclosed in a red circle with a red bar across it  and b a sign at every entrance that clearly states that smoking including smoking of ecigarettes is prohibited 2 remove all ashtrays except in designated smoking areas  31317 designated smoking areas notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter to the contrary the city of lewiston may designate smoking areas in outdoor spaces the city of lewiston shall designate a smoking area for all public parks such designated smoking areas shall be clearly marked the city of lewiston shall not designate smoking areas inside public buildings or within twenty 20 feet of any entrance or exit of a public building  31317 exemptions notwithstanding any other provision of this chapter to the contrary the following shall be exempt from the provisions of sections 415 and 416 of this code 1 areas designated as smoking areas by the city of lewiston in accordance with section 417 of this code 2 religious practices a person is exempt from the provisions of this chapter if the person is smoking as part of a bona fide religious ceremony or practice which is protected by the first amendment  31317 penalty a a person who violates section 415 of this code shall receive a written warning the first time such person violates section 415 of this code b for each violation thereafter a person who violates section 415 of this code shall be guilty of an infraction punishable by a fine of fifty dollars $5000 c violation of this chapter is hereby declared to be a public nuisance which may be abated by the city of lewiston by restraining order preliminary and permanent injunction or other means provided for by law  and the city of lewiston may take action to recover attorney fees andor costs of the nuisance abatement  31317 other applicable laws this chapter shall not be interpreted or construed to permit smoking where it is otherwise restricted by other applicable laws  31317 severability if any provision of this chapter is declared unconstitutional or otherwise invalid by judgment or decree of a court of competent jurisdiction such unconstitutionality or invalidity shall not affect any other provision of this chapter that can be given effect without the invalid provision  31317 shelters art i homeless shelters  421  4215 article i homeless shelters homeless shelter standards where a homeless shelter is allowed as a use permitted outright or as a conditional use in of this code the owner andor operator of such homeless shelter shall comply with the following standards unless otherwise amended by a conditional use permit or variance approval 1 a minimum of five 5 and a maximum of fifty 50 beds shall be provided 2 onsite management shall be provided by a minimum of one 1 staff person for a homeless shelter with twenty 20 occupied beds or less and a minimum of two 2 staff persons for a homeless shelter with more than twenty 20 occupied beds during all hours of operation 3 a facility management plan shall be submitted with each application for building permit for a homeless shelter such plan shall address the following a the training program who what how when where to be provided for facility staff including any volunteer staff such training shall include 1 review of the facility management plan  2 training specific to conflict resolution  mediation  what to do if encountering a person displaying violent suicidal or criminal behavior or suffering from a mental health crisis  abuse prevention  and substance abuse prevention  and 3 any other type of training deemed appropriate by the homeless shelter owner andor operator  b protocols to address client acceptance length of stay and ancillary service offerings including relationships with and referrals to and from other related service providers  c protocols to address emergency response and security for homeless shelter staff including volunteer staff and clients  d protocols to address outdoor noise litter indecent exposure disturbing the peace and other public nuisances  and e protocols to address neighborhood outreach and response to complaints 4 operation of a homeless shelter shall be in compliance with the facility management plan 5 securable storage facilities for personal property of residents and overnight clients equal to a minimum of eighteen 18 cubic feet per bed shall be provided  42417 administration and enforcement the community development department shall administer the provisions of this article this article shall be enforced by the community development department andor the code enforcement officer additionally in the event that violation of this article creates a public nuisance such public nuisance may be abated by the city of lewiston by restraining order preliminary and permanent injunction or other means provided for by law  and the city of lewiston may take action to recover attorney fees andor costs of the nuisance abatement  42417 appeals a a person aggrieved by a written order or decision by the community development director pursuant to this article may appeal such written order or decision to the city council by filing a written notice of appeal with the city clerk within fifteen 15 calendar days of receipt of such written order or decision the notice of appeal shall specify the grounds for appeal service of the community development directors written order or decision may be accomplished by hand delivery or by mail if such order or decision is handdelivered it shall be deemed received immediately if such order or decision is served by mail it shall be deemed received fortyeight 48 hours after depositing the same in the us mail first class certified or registered  postage prepaid  and addressed to the recipients last known address if an appeal is not filed within fifteen 15 calendar days of receipt of the community development directors written order or decision then the decision of the community development director shall be final b upon a timely notice of appeal the city council may either 1 refuse to accept jurisdiction of the appeal in which case the decision of the community development director shall be final  or 2 hold a hearing on the appeal within thirty 30 calendar days of receipt of the notice of appeal c if the city council holds a hearing on the appeal then notice of such hearing shall be published at least once in a newspaper of general circulation in the city of lewiston at least fifteen 15 days prior to the hearing additionally notice of such hearing shall be mailed to the owners of all properties within three hundred 300 feet of the exterior boundary of the property that is the subject of such hearing notices shall be mailed at least eight 8 calendar days prior to the hearing all notices shall include the date time and place of the hearing as well as a short statement as to the subject matter of the hearing if notice is required to be mailed to two hundred 200 or more property owners then public announcements of the hearing may be made in lieu of mailing notice such public announcements shall be made on local radio and televisions stations at least five 5 but not more than fifteen 15 calendar days prior to the hearing d if the city council holds a hearing on the appeal then the appellant shall have the right to be represented by legal counsel at the hearing and rebut any evidence that is submitted the formal rules of evidence shall not apply e the city council shall issue a written decision within twenty 20 calendar days after the hearing the city council may affirm reverse or modify the decision of the community development director the city councils decision shall be final f an appeal other than an appeal of an emergency order shall stay enforcement of the written order or decision until the appeal is heard and a final decision is rendered  42417 severability if any provision of this article is declared unconstitutional or otherwise invalid by judgment or decree of a court of competent jurisdiction such unconstitutionality or invalidity shall not affect any other provision of this article that can be given effect without the invalid provision  42417  reserved
